result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Feltz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First half in jail, second half can be served on GPS Electronic Monitoring. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. **Stip/Order 07-29-16: JOC is amended to permit Defendant to serve the jail sentence in Waupaca County Jail or any other county jail where Mr. Feltz is employed or resides. Transfer is contingent upon the Portage County Jail and the Waupaca County jail or other qualifying jail accepting the transfer.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges. Bond applied.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
No contact direct or indirect with Ashley Oleson.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions must be from one (1) pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so department can monitor medications, pharmacies and treatment being prescribed. 
Provide a list of all medications that are prescribed. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Costs shall be taken from the bond, balance returned to the poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Feltz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant in re:  sentence credit **cc:  ADA Cousins and Atty Sheila Kessler
(Amend JOC to permit Defendant to serve the jail sentence in Waupaca County Jail, if qualifies and approved by the jails.) /s/TTF 07-29-16

Defendant Brandon Feltz in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deseree Parr also appears.

11:01 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This involves a bond issue. 

Court reviews the file, Court received a note from Ms. Roth regarding bond.  Bond was posted in this case of $4,000. Fines/costs were taken out, there was a balance remaining, to be returned to poster. Person who posted the bond may not be the person who receives the balance.

11:03 AM Deseree Parr is called and sworn by the Court.
Examination by the Court.

Justin Hefferly is addressed, the person who's name is posted on the paperwork.

Ms. Parr addresses the Court, explains.  
Ms. Parr shows text message to Court - sent by Heff on June 21st at 1:34 am. Court reads the text. 

Court notes that Justin Hefferly was also given notice of today's hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court will find that actual poster of bond was Ms. Parr and Mr. Hefferly was the courier of the money.  
Curt orders the balance be released to Ms. Parr.
Request for hearing for clarification of bond refund
Review hearing on June 24, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Brandon Feltz in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:39 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  There are no additions or corrections at this time. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Count 1 - 
Serve 1 year jail. 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
First half in jail, second half can be served on GPS Electronic Monitoring. 

Court questions the defendant re: custody. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 continued: 
14 days jail credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 

Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for 4 years: 
No contact direct or indirect with Ashley Oleson. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions must be from one (1) pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so department can monitor medications, pharmacies and treatment being prescribed. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Provide a list of all medications that are prescribed. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Costs shall be taken from the bond, balance returned to the poster. 

Court advises of post-conviction. 
Parties will retain a copy of the PSI in their files, confidentially.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Feltz in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:08 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

Defendant will enter a plea to Count 1 and Count 2. 
Count 3 and Count 4 will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Cousins requests a PSI.

State is capping at 6 year prison sentence with further conditions that may be argued at sentencing.

Atty Kessler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kessler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

Voting rights are handed to Defendant while sentencing date is discussed.

BY THE COURT:
PSI to be completed by May 13th. Copies to be forwarded to the parties.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Feltz in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:23 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant indicates he spoke with the public defender and they indicated he did qualify for representation.  
Court asks Atty Halverson, who is present on other matters, to contact her office re: status of his appointment. 
Court questions the defendant re: Atty Kryshak.  
Atty Halverson indicates Atty Sheila Kessler is appointed. 

Court advises the defendant to see the public defender today after court. 
Atty Cousins indicates he will send an email to Atty Kessler. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Feltz in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:59 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This matter is set for a continued pre-trial conference.  
Court questions re: failure to have representation by an attorney.  Defendant replies to the court.  
Court questions the financial information of defendant.  Defendant replies.  

BTC:
Court orders the defendant to go the public defender to see if he is eligible for representation.  
Defendant can come back to court if he is not eligible and the proceed that is followed to have a county appointed attorney.  
Court advises he should not have allowed Attorney Kryshak to withdraw 
Court continues to question the defendant re: employment.  
Bond is ordered continues.

10:06 a.m case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Feltz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:58 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Kryshak moves to withdraw as the defendant has requested to hire his own counsel.  He was appointed thru the public defender. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant will have an attorney within 30 days. 

BY THE COURT:  Motion to withdraw is granted.   Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

3:09 p.m. Defendant Brandon Feltz in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Brandon Feltz in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Cousins calls witness, Tony Gishchia, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. 3:13 p.m Cross exam by Atty Kryshak.
  BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment: 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Atty Kryshak requests Bond to be amended to a sig bond.
ADA Cousins states objection to motion for bond modification.

BTC:  Bond remains. It is a Branch 3 case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with co-defendants: Ashley Oleson, Andrew Craney
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.

Defendant Brandon Feltz appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
(Defendant indicates his name is Brandon Turzinski-Feltz.)
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is not represented by counsel yet and has not been contacted by the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant works for cash for his father doing landscaping. 

State recommends a $4,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
